headline: Kemp holding large lead over Perdue in Georgia governor race: Fox News poll
author: Monique Beals
sentences: Georgias gubernatorial race has been a central battleground for Trumps false claims about the 2020 election being stolen, with the former president targeting Kemp, a onetime ally who rebuffed his efforts to overturn his election loss in the state.
Kemp was holding 60 percent of Georgia Republican primary voters support, compared to 28 percent for Perdue and 8 percent for other candidates in the primary.
While former President Trump has endorsed Perdue, 24 percent of participants in the poll said the endorsement made them less supportive of Perdue.
Brian Kemp is 32 points ahead of former Sen. David Perdue in the states GOP gubernatorial primary, according to a new Fox News poll out Wednesday.
The Fox News poll was conducted between May 12 and May 16, with a margin of error of 3 percentage points.
Just last week, Trump warned that a vote for Kemp would further erode Georgias election integrity.?
Pence is expected to attend a rally for Kemp on May 23, one day before the primary on May 24.
Thirty-seven percent, however, said Trumps support made them support Perdue more.
It includes a sampling of 1,004 Georgia Republican primary voters.
Former Vice President Mike Pence threw his support behind Kemp.
Another 36 percent said the endorsement had no effect on them.
Three percent of voters remain undecided, the poll showed.
